headline: CNN Live Event/Special
subHeadline: CNN's New Year's Eve Live. Aired 9:30-10a ET

utterances.speaker: KRISTIE LU STOUT, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: And, Julia, you got something special cooking up for New Year's Eve?

utterances.speaker: JULIA CHATTERLEY, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: Always. But the good news for our viewers, Kristie, is I'm not actually cooking because that would be a firework display of a whole different kind and probably not a good one, quite frankly. But if you're in New York City and you fancy some fabulous Indian food, then bungalow restaurant different kind and probably not a good one, quite frankly. But if you're in New York City and you fancy some fabulous Indian food, then bungalow restaurant is one of the hottest tickets and the hardest reservations to get.Now at the helm is author, film director and Michelin star chef himself, Vikas Khanna. He's also one of my dear friends. And the good news is he actually helped me rustle up a dish for New Year's Eve. No reservation required. Watch this. (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: VIKAS KHANNA, CELEBRITY CHEF
utterances.sentences: Good to see you guys. Amazing to be at bungalow.

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: So, what are we cooking?

utterances.speaker: KHANNA
utterances.sentences: We are making a very interesting, very quick dish. But this sauce is where the magic happens. It's a sauce which you're going to make in one minute. You're going to heat some oil. One minute sauce, one minute sauce. That's simple.

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: KHANNA
utterances.sentences: And here, of course, you can see this beautiful spice.

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes, it looks beautiful. Am I going to be let loose on the sauce?

utterances.speaker: KHANNA
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: Uh-oh.

utterances.speaker: KHANNA
utterances.sentences: Two teaspoons of turmeric.

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: This is flat teaspoons or this is good or too much. KHANNA

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: Just good. Just go for it.

utterances.speaker: KHANNA
utterances.sentences: One more.

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: One more?

utterances.speaker: KHANNA
utterances.sentences: This is the trick which I've learned in working in so many Indian kitchens. That's it. You just need hot oil and turmeric.

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: The smell already.

utterances.speaker: KHANNA
utterances.sentences: And now it's cooled down to this. I'm going to add labneh, which is like honey yogurt.You can use Greek yogurt now. You can add lemon juice to it. It's right there in the bowl.

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: Am I going to do that?

utterances.speaker: KHANNA
utterances.sentences: Yeah. That's yuzu lemon juice.

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: Straight in.

utterances.speaker: KHANNA
utterances.sentences: Straight in. Now I'm going to add a little salt and sugar.

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: It's good.

utterances.speaker: KHANNA
utterances.sentences: That's good.

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: See? Look at that.

utterances.speaker: KHANNA
utterances.sentences: That's it.

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: I was a born -- born to be a chef's assistant.(LAUGHTER)

utterances.speaker: KHANNA
utterances.sentences: That's it. The sauce is ready.

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: It looks yummy.

utterances.speaker: KHANNA
utterances.sentences: It's just one minute, and then it becomes even better when you eat it next day. Now you see this?

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: Oh, yes. Yes.

utterances.speaker: KHANNA
utterances.sentences: It's rich, creamy. It's totally so different.

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: I want some more. You should have given me a bigger spoon.

utterances.speaker: KHANNA
utterances.sentences: Right there.

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: Give me that one now. Now we're talking. KHANNAamazing. It's also very auspicious, especially on New Year's time that our grandmothers gave us a glass of turmeric with milk. It is for health and well-being. My grandmother, who was the best chef I've ever known. She said that Indian kitchen is a dispensary. It has remedies for everything.

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: Oh, let's step back. Wow, it's getting spicy.

utterances.speaker: KHANNA
utterances.sentences: Once the scallops are ready, I'm going to sprinkle a little bit of zaatar spice mix. You're going to add one dollop of butter.

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: And what is here. Are you going to talk us through it when we do it? Yeah. The decoration/

utterances.speaker: KHANNA
utterances.sentences: All the garnishing.

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: I like the decoration, especially since its sort of I was clearly dressing for the occasion. Look at that. Out they come.

utterances.speaker: KHANNA
utterances.sentences: That's it.

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: I can already taste how good this is going to be with the lemon and the yuzu. It's so easy, she says, watching someone else do it. Ta-da! We get to try it now. Ready?Mhm. Wow. No, I'm keeping it.

utterances.speaker: KHANNA
utterances.sentences: Okay. Happy New Year.

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: Happy New Year.

utterances.speaker: KHANNA
utterances.sentences: Happy New Year.

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: Congrats.It's just the beginning. Happy New Year, everybody. Can I have some more?

utterances.speaker: KHANNA
utterances.sentences: It's all yours.

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: Good. Good answer.(END VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: Vikas knows me well enough to know my skill set. Suited far more to eating than to cooking, Kristie. But I'm definitely ready for breakfast. Now, you're ready for the canapes? Of course you are. Happy New Year! I tried. STOUT

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: True skill. True skill.

utterances.speaker: STOUT
utterances.sentences: True skill.Julia, thank you so much.

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: He's nervous laugh said it all.

utterances.speaker: STOUT
utterances.sentences: The countdown -- you need that butter to everything in this New Year 2025. Thank you. Julia. We'll talk again soon.We are also closing in on 2025 very closely in Tokyo. And that's where we're going to find CNN correspondent Hanako Montgomery. Hanako, we are inching ever closer to midnight there. Can you describe the mood? And also, can you introduce us to a hometown hero?

utterances.speaker: YUTO HORIGOME, OLYMPIAN
utterances.sentences: Super special, like the place to me. You know, I growing up in this Koto City, in Tokyo.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Now, the world is his playground.From California to Paris to Brazil, Horigome is picking up medals and breaking records. The two-time Olympic medalist is the name in skateboarding right now, and he has the tricks to prove it. During Horigome's recent trip to Japan, I challenged him to a showdown at live door Ariake Urban Sports Park, where he first won Olympic gold. And then here, right? Okay, maybe not, but he's a good sport about it. Horigome lives in L.A. now, and every trip back to Japan reminds him of how different the skateboarding culture is here.

utterances.speaker: HORIGOME
utterances.sentences: In Japan, like when you skating on the street, like if people doesn't like get it. Skateboarding an Olympics is obviously sports, but like skateboarding, more like culture and street. It's still very important. And I'm growing up like that. So like I don't want to forget.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: So how do you want to change skateboarding culture in Japan?

utterances.speaker: HORIGOME
utterances.sentences: Definitely. I wanted to make more big. Maybe like if I can skate like more like free in Japan, like streetskating.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Add that to his to do list for the New Year.

utterances.speaker: HORIGOME
utterances.sentences: Next year is the Tampa Pro. That contests like super special because it has like a lot of history back in the day. So no one had three in a row, so I want to try like three in a row.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Okay. Like a hat trick.

utterances.speaker: HORIGOME
utterances.sentences: That's super important to me, actually, even tricks, too, like, you know, I wanted to do like, the trick. Like no one does. Maybe 2026, like, Trasher has skater of the year. That's like, everyone want to get it. Like, that's my dream too. So --(END VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: And, Kristie, I'm making a promise to you right now. By this time next year, I will have some skateboarding tricks to show you -- Kristie.

utterances.speaker: STOUT
utterances.sentences: Yes, yes, because I know you can do it. I got to know you really well this last year. Hanako, you can set your mind to do anything. And that includes an ollie. So I expect you to learn and to perform an ollie, especially when you have the ultimate teacher right there in Japan.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: I can disappoint you.

utterances.speaker: STOUT
utterances.sentences: Live imagery from Tokyo. An epic Taiko drum performance. Did you see the size of that one drum? All set to ring in the New Year?Meanwhile, here in Hong Kong, we're about an hour and 20 minutes or so away from what promises to be the most spectacular firework musical to date. And joining me now are a couple of revelers. Hey there, Erica and Jackson, your brother and sister?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: STOUT
utterances.sentences: This is your first time being out here to see the fireworks? Yes. You grew up in Hong Kong, but this is a first experience for you. What are you looking forward to?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Oh, I'm so looking forward to the countdown. Everyone just counting together. It's going to be a great atmosphere.

utterances.speaker: STOUT
utterances.sentences: Because the countdown is going to be projected on the convention center, and everyone's just going to be yelling out the numbers as we go, right?And so are you looking forward to 2025? Do you have goals in 2025?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I have a goal and 25. I want to perform a drama show.

utterances.speaker: STOUT
utterances.sentences: Oh.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes, and maybe some card tricks in terms of card tricks and performing in front of in front of our classmates or my sister or my family.

utterances.speaker: STOUT
utterances.sentences: You're the older sister. You're already in drama school, right?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: STOUT
utterances.sentences: Do you have New Year's resolution for 2025?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Oh, yes. We're doing a "La La Land" medley. I hope that goes well.

utterances.speaker: STOUT
utterances.sentences: Oh, my gosh, that sounds fantastic. You mentioned card tricks. Can you show me a card trick right now?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Oh, okay.

utterances.speaker: STOUT
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Here is a very normal.

utterances.speaker: STOUT
utterances.sentences: He carries his own cards. Yeah. Very normal. Okay. Bicycle cards? Yeah, I know the brand.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Can you help me pick the card?

utterances.speaker: STOUT
utterances.sentences: Okay. I'm just. You're trying to make me pick that one, so I'm going to go for this one. All right, there we go.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Just memorize it.

utterances.speaker: STOUT
utterances.sentences: Yeah, it's easy to memorize. Yeah.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Okay. And then, is it okay? I put it right over here.

utterances.speaker: STOUT
utterances.sentences: You have my permission? Yes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes. Okay, good. I'll put it right over here.And it's a very simple thing that if I flip this card, it wouldn't be yours, right?

utterances.speaker: STOUT
utterances.sentences: No, it's not my card.

utterances.speaker: STOUT
utterances.sentences: Show it to the camera. That is my card. It was the ace of hearts. Oh my gosh.Jackson and Erica, thank you so much. Happy New Year. That was fantastic. I love it. The New Year is already getting good vibes. I'm already getting the good vibes. We're also going to get good vibes now with our next guest. You may have heard of spark joy. That's the mantra from Marie Kondo for organizing our closets, organizing our lives. Now she is the decluttering guru. She has inspired millions, including myself, to tidy up with a book, with a Netflix show, with a consulting business. Earlier, Marie joined me from Japan and I started by asking her, how can we spark joy in 2025? (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: MARIE KONDO, ORGANIZATION EXPERT, KONMARI FOUNDER
utterances.sentences: In Japan, we do the end of the year cleaning. It's called Osoji.Japanese want to make sure that their home are spotless before the New Year. We believe that luck easily comes into our home when everything is tidy.

utterances.speaker: STOUT
utterances.sentences: Marie Kondo, you are the queen of decluttering. You make it sound so serene, but really, how do you do it? How do you tidy up your home? Especially when you have three children running around the house?

utterances.speaker: KONDO
utterances.sentences: Yes, I agreed that it is difficult to tidy my home with three kids. However, to make things easier, I recommend three points.First, make the habit of tidying with kids. And second, designate spot for things. It is important for kids to know and to see where the items are. It makes it easier for them to tidy up by themselves. And finally, be relaxed when tidying.

utterances.speaker: STOUT
utterances.sentences: And looking ahead to 2025, what is a goal that any person can commit to in the New Year?

utterances.speaker: KONDO
utterances.sentences: If you have not tidied your home yet, start now. How to clean up your belongings. You will take natural steps on. Tidy your work, your mind and your relationships and all aspects of your lives, and you can then transform your lives and surrounding yourself with only what sparks joy for you.

utterances.speaker: STOUT
utterances.sentences: Marie Kondo, thank you so much. Thank you for spending time with us here at CNN and happy New Year.

utterances.speaker: KONDO
utterances.sentences: Thank you. Thank you so much. Thank you for having me and happy New Year.(END VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: STOUT
utterances.sentences: Marie Kondo makes it sound so easy, but it is so hard to get rid of that moldy teddy bear.Now we are a few minutes away from the New Year in Tokyo, and CNN will bring you the energy, the festivities, as Japan rings in 2025 in style. Now the current pride of Osaka, Japan comes in the form of a dazzling dance troupe called Avantgardey. Now they wowed the judges at Americas got talent in 2023, and since then they have toured Asia, gaining millions of fans. I recently got a chance to meet up with them during a break in their now very busy schedule. (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) STOUT (voice-over):  Eccentric energetic and always in sync, they may look like bob hair dolls, but Avantgardey is a show-stopping dance troupe that is ready for world domination. In 2023, the Japanese dance crew stunned the judges at "America's Got Talent". Yes, and have toured across Asia, including a stop in Hong Kong. Oh my gosh Avantgardey, they're in the building. They're in the building. At the city's M+ Museum of Contemporary Visual Culture, we meet nine of the 17 dancers. Welcome again to Hong Kong.

utterances.speaker: AVANTGARDEY
utterances.sentences: Yay!

utterances.speaker: STOUT
utterances.sentences: First, we need to talk about your look. What inspired the concept?

utterances.speaker: SONO, AVANTGARDEY
utterances.sentences: All of these decisions are made by our producer, Akane. By having everyone wear the same uniform and perform the same movements in this way, I think we're able to deliver a strange and unique performance.

utterances.speaker: STOUT
utterances.sentences: How involved are you creatively in coming up with your dance moves?

utterances.speaker: NONA, AVANTGARDEY
utterances.sentences: Our producer, Akane, comes up with the choreography. And when we have our live performances, we come up with ideas and work together to create the piece.

utterances.speaker: STOUT
utterances.sentences: In 2024. It has been a big year for Avantgardey. What was it like managing that touring schedule and also the fame.

utterances.speaker: KOHANA, AVANTGARDEY
utterances.sentences: We were very happy to be able to actually meet he fans from all over the world. The fans cheered in a different way compared to Japanese fans and we were very surprised and happy to see their enthusiasm.SIMON COWELL, JUDGE, AMERICA'S GOT TALENT:  That was genius.

utterances.speaker: STOUT
utterances.sentences: That moment when you stunned the judges, incredible. What was that like?

utterances.speaker: NAGANO, AVANTGARDEY
utterances.sentences: At first, they thought we were a very strange team, but by the end of our performance, the audience and the judges, everyone was smiling, and we were very honored to know that we could move people's emotions just by dancing even though we couldn't speak the language.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I love you girls.

utterances.speaker: AVANTGARDEY
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: STOUT
utterances.sentences: What are your hopes and dreams for 2025? KOHANAStates one day.

utterances.speaker: STOUT
utterances.sentences: Avantgardey, it's been so cool to hang out with all of you. Thank you so much and happy New Year!

utterances.speaker: AVANTGARDEY
utterances.sentences: Happy New Year!(END VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: STOUT
utterances.sentences: Welcome back.You're looking live at the festivities in Tokyo, a massive light projection that's only going to get even bigger because we are just minutes away from midnight there. We want to welcome you to CNN's special coverage of New Year's Eve Live. I'm Kristie Lu Stout, live in Hong Kong.

utterances.speaker: BRIANNA KEILAR, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: And I'm Brianna Keilar at the Marriott Marquis in New York's Times Square.And all day long, CNN is taking you around the world as we welcome 2025 with you in style until everyone everywhere rings in the New Year, Kristie.

utterances.speaker: STOUT
utterances.sentences: Brianna, it's so great to party with you this evening. Hong Kong time, and let's bring up the clock. You can see it right here. Excitement building over in Japan, where it is on the cusp of midnight.So it's time to check in once again with CNN's Hanako Montgomery. She joins us live in Tokyo. Hanako, we've done this before. Last year, you introduced us to a New Year's Eve treat in Tokyo. And it involves slurping. Bring on the food.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Hi, Kristie. Yeah, you're absolutely right. I mean, last year, I think I introduced you to something called Toshikoshi Soba, which is a traditional dish that we eat here in Japan. Honestly, its one of my favorite foods to eat during the holidays. And I actually got to try some myself nearby at our Illumination Market near the venue.Here's what it tasted like. (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) (SPEAKING JAPANESE)

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: So I just got my hot bowl of steaming soba noodles. This is a traditional dish that we eat here in Japan. It's called Toshikoshi Soba and it's made of soba noodles or buckwheat noodles. And because they're long, they're supposed to represent having a healthy life. They're supposed to represent longevity.And also because they're easier to cut than other types of noodles, it's supposed to represent cutting yourself off from all the bad vibes of the previous year. This looks delicious. I'm so excited to dig in. Itadakimasu. (END VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: And, Kristie, I already feel like I am rid of all the bad vibes of 2024. I am so looking forward to welcoming 2025 in less than five minutes -- Kristie.

utterances.speaker: KEILAR
utterances.sentences: I love that, cutting off all of the bad energy. I think something we should all aim for, Hanako.So I know a lot of people are there ready to party behind you. How do folks normally ring in the New Year in Japan?

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Brianna, I'm so glad you asked that. Normally in New Years, right around New Years holidays in Japan, we celebrate it at home with our families. We eat as much good food as possible, trying to spend as much time on the couch as possible. So it's really great to actually see hundreds of people.In fact. In fact, thousands of people really ringing in the New Year. They are looking at this beautiful projection mapping that we have here on the skyscraper right behind me. And I'm just seeing here now, we have less than two minutes to go. We have about a minute 30 to go until 2025. And Brianna, there are young people here, old people, families, partners, couples. I mean, just such a wide range of people. And they are all looking forward to all the joy that 2025 is sure to bring.

utterances.speaker: STOUT
utterances.sentences: And, Hanako, once the clock strikes midnight, which is just over one minute away, what are you going to be looking out for?
